p: In Portugal, the estimated average production of apples is 265,000 t/year, being the main permanent crop in mainland Portugal, followed by orange and pear [ 16]. Currently, 14,580 ha are used for apple production in the country. Data indicate that in 2018 apple production was around 264,000 tonnes ( Figure 1) [ 17]. Due to favorable weather conditions, in 2019 there was an increase in production, more significantly in the region of Tr√°s-os-Montes (+65%) [ 18], reaching a national production of 355,700 tonnes.
